title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Quite easy, first round was just a phone screening with a few questions. It was less than 30 mins and if you move on you attend an in person interview at Fred Hutch.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Fred Hutch?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: The phone interviewer clearly was unhappy with her job and it put a bad feeling in my mind about the role. They had a lot of long pauses and it was very awkward.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current role?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Two-part interview, initial HR screen to see if you qualify, interview with the Principle investigator to learn your interest, motivation, personality, etc. Interviews are virtual using Microsoft office (not zoom), or phone calls.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: fast, easy and expedite. The people who interview me was nice and they explained all the job in a practical way. They show me the people who are part of the team and the facilities
Interview Questions: Do you live close by?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with a friendly recruiter where you walk through the job and your background. There is transparency with pay and flexibility up front which is helpful throughout the interview process
Interview Questions: What kind of management style do you respond best to?

title: Rehab RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer showed up late, asked a few pre written “ what would you do” questions, talked about herself , asked my background, talked about herself more, gave general information about the position which was different from the advertised position, talked about herself some more and the interview ended. Probably the most unprofessional interview I have ever had.
Interview Questions: Google “ interview questions Fred hutch”

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I really believe in what the org does! I was so excited when I got a call and prepared so well. But I was extremely disappointed in how the recruiter spoke and how aloof and not excited she was. I was taken aback immediately and felt like she did not care at all. This is a two-way street and the person interviewing needs to really understand that and not make the interviewee feel weird
Interview Questions: Just general questions about previous experience; why am i interested in the role; how did I solve for analytic issue

title: DEI Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: First, there was a recruiter screen then a one-on-one interview with a member of the team, and then a more broad panel interview. The team members I met with were nice, but I felt extremely disrespected throughout the process. The recruiter was rude during the screening call and called late. The process was so lengthy, I doubted their sincerity. Multiple panelists did not show up for the interview. After speaking several times, 6 months after initially applying, I received a generic HR rejection. I was also bothered by their unwillingness to state the salary range until I gave them a number frustrating considering their purported commitment to DEI.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with adult professionals?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen followed by two Zoom interviews. It was a pleasant experience. I ultimately did not get an offer but feel like I was able to have good conversations and learn more about the organization.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience working in DEI and why is it valuable

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening for first interview, second and third were done on tele conference. Second was done with the manager, then the third and final was done with other team members.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a frustrated patient?

title: Advanced Practice Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple interviews. First a phone screen to review my clinical experience and overall interest in the role. Then there were multiple online interviews with different providers. Each intervenes covered covered different aspects including clinical experience, healthcare equity, diversity, research interests and example clinical scenarios
Interview Questions: What is your leadership experience

title: Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the Recruiter and it (seemingly) went really well. The call lasted 45 minutes instead of the scheduled 30 because the Recruiter said he was really enjoying getting to know me and wanted to talk further. At the end of the call he made it clear he wanted to move me along in the process and asked for my availability for the coming week. He said he would find a good time for me to meet with the hiring manager and then send me email confirmation of my next interview. I never heard from him again despite 2 attempts on my end to reach out and hear an update. Super unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume

title: Genomics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took 1 month. The first stage is a phone screen with the in-house recruiter (20 mins) . The next stage is the virtual interview with a panel ( hiring manager, Sr Director, admin manager, and bioinformatics lab director (1 hour). The final stage is 1-hour interview with peers. The whole process was seamless starting from communication, scheduling, and interviews. They are real professionals and know their field very well.
Interview Questions: Phone screen: 1. Why do you want to want here? Why this position? 2. How much experience do you have with X,Y,Z skills? General questions regarding experience without asking technical specifics. Interview with directors: 1.Tell us about yourself 2.Why do you have a gap in your career? 3. Tell us about QC of RNA/libraries 4. How do you manage multiple projects? 5. Did you get feedback from the bioinformatics team? 6. Did you have experience with X, Y, X? Tell us about that 7. What questions do you have? Final peer level interview: 1.How do you communicate with ppl with different personalities 2. What schedule do you prefer? 3. Tell us about X project 4. What equipment did you use? 5. QC questions 6. How do you stay on track ? 7. Tell us about yourself Advice: Just be yourself, give honest answers, and show your excitement and enthusiasm! Know all information relevant to your job description and do research even more about their work, equipment, and team members. Show that you really care.

title: Healh Behavioral Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions:
1.- After applying I received an email to have a phone call.
2.- I talked the Sr recruiter about generalities about the job and the project.
3.- After some days I received an email to set a video interviews with people that was working in the project.
4.- I had a video-call with 6 people at least at the same time, they were reading multiple questions. During more than an hour. They said they will let me know their decision in 2 weeks.

5.- It’s been more than a month. Fortunately I found a job that is serious.

What shocked me more about this experience was:
- Why companies ghost you in 2022?
- Why to have unorganized interviews with multiple people at the same time?

Seems like I am not the only one with this experience. Red flags!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Firstly they set up a screening call a few weeks after I first applied. After this I had a teams video call with the main researcher I'd be working under who gets a better sense of your qualifications and ambitions.
Interview Questions: What made you want to work at the Hutch?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I had two 30 minute interviews via Teams video call.

The first one was with the manager who was so lovely and warm. She asked a few questions regarding work experience, my experience with diversity, how I heard about them, and why I was interested in the position.

The second one was with two members of the team. One nurse, and one patient care coordinator. In this one they asked questions about past work experience, how I would handle the work load, their daily tasks, why you're interested in the position.
I would say come prepared with questions about the work place to try and get a better feel for what the position and daily routine would look like.

Overall I really enjoyed the process and meeting with the team. They pay well for the position and seem to have a safe and supportive work environment. I would've accepted but I decided not to make the move from my current location.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you experienced diversity in the workplace or regular life?

Why SCCA (soon to be Fred Hutch)?

Describe your former role.

What do you want to be doing in 5 years?

title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The experience was overall very positive. The Interview was done via Zoom. It felt more like a genuine conversation than an interview. Quick and simple. Employer communicated well throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews. The first interview was with HR and then the second interview was with the role's hiring manager and their manager.  Heard back two weeks later. Overall a smooth process.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize your work?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Was relatively long but all the people I met through the process were incredible! There is lots of amazing research occurring at Fred Hutch and there is excitement about it throughout the interview process.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this position?

title: Research Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: really short, like 15 mins, two interviewers, fast pace. mainly talk about my resume. Only 2 rounds of interviews, the first one is a phone interview with the HR. It has been 2 months and I have not received any feedback. The applicant dashboard still says 'interview completed, under review. I don't know what takes them so long. Low work efficiency. I assume they found a better candidate and just forgot to update the dashboard.
Interview Questions: Talk about your resume. Talk about your education. What questions do you have for us.

title: Product Owner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Up front with budget for the job, minimized the number of interviews but still made time for you to meet the team. Recruiter was great to work with and keep me updated frequently on process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a phone screen which asked basic questions. Then, I received a take-home tech assessment to complete. After I submitted the tech assessment, I was then called for an interview that was supposed to go over my tech assessment. However, instead of going over my tech assessment, they instead asked me a bunch of stats questions (for a dev role???) and nothing relevant to my technical assessment at all. I was completely blindsided.
Interview Questions: "Why do you want to work here?". "Tell me about yourself."

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Two rounds of interviews/conversations, both were with a panel. The first included the hiring manager and two senior staff, the second included peers. 
The group I was interviewing with functions somewhat as an autonomous start up within the organization, so the format was relatively informal/conversational.
Interview Questions: Why this role/why Fred Hutch

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a little longer than most places, however the recruiters were very friendly and easy to converse with.  The response is pretty fast when you reach out to them for follow up or any other questions you have with them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy! Staff was very friendly and answered all questions thoroughly. Asked several questions about diversity. Appears to be a big focus with the company. Haven’t experienced that feeling in an interview but really appreciated it.
Interview Questions: What is diversity to you?

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: 30-minute recruiter conversation through Teams.  The Recruiter was prompt and professional in communication, and easy to talk to in the interview.   Standard  "walk me through your resume" and answer questions conversation.
Interview Questions:
Experience with Volunteer management
What are you looking for in your next role

title: Bioinformatician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone screen.  Was a casual process with a senior researcher and an HR member who was organizing the process.  Next became an interview via zoom with another researcher as well.
Interview Questions: Q: Are you experienced analyzing single cell RNA-sequencing?

title: Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Just finished an interview with a recruiter who was very abrupt and cut me off multiple times. She would ask me to "describe my experience" and then rudely cut me off when I started detailing my prior responsibilities. She would also phrase questions confusingly and then get upset when I answered her questions.  The position was listed as remote but then she seemed to take issue that I wouldn't move to Washington. This was probably one of the worst phone screens that I have ever encountered. I believe someone who left a negative interview review here may have spoken to her as well...If I were offered a position here, I would decline because she was such a bad representation of the company. Really left a sour taste in my mouth. I almost want to email her back now and withdraw my application. Will update if I hear back.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in your next position?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: First, I had two interviews with HR. After that, I interviewed with my manager and my Principal Investigator. Finally, I did a project to prove my skills. I was hired after that process.
Interview Questions: Basic questions and one project

title: Statistical Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: interview with human resources, behavioral interview with hiring manager, coding sample. The interview process was spread out over a few months for no reason. I was ghosted by the recruiter at the end.
Interview Questions: What are important coding practices?

title: Administrative Manager I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Apply online May 7th and was emailed for a phone screen two weeks later with the recruiter. The hiring manager was out of vacation so was not able to do my second interview until the first week of June . I had my second interview on a Tuesday and was schedule for my final interview the very next day. I received my job offer later that afternoon. The whole process took about a month.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume. Why did you apply for this job?  How are you will learning new application? Are you committed to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion?

title: Research Administrator III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process moved quickly and the team was very engaged. I had a first round with the department director, supervisor and team member. The second interview round was with the remainder of the team members. I wish I would have been able to meet/interview with some Principal Investigators for the department to understand the working relationship.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple deadlines and projects?

title: Statistical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Had a 10 min phone screen with the recruiter who passed my info on to the rest of the department. Was then asked to attend an hour long zoom call giving me information about the role and answering any questions I had. Then, I was offered a final interview which was 3 hours long and I met with 4 different groups of people. The whole interview process was very seamless! Everyone was extremely nice and communicative. They always got back to me in a very timely manner and the interviews were very conversational.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The Recruiter T was not very nice. She didn’t seem like she understood the job, just read what was in the TOR.I have years of experience but she came across that I was just at the wrong place. Work on diversity. Managers need to hire direct instead of this. This is not a good system
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself ?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward. During the interview I thought everything was going well. Although, I never heard back from anyone! A month later I looked on company website and saw that I was not selected.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict

title: Software Development Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Entire process took two months, only because the PI of the lab being applied to had a large grant due. Applied online and then had a phone screen from the in-house recruiter. Then I had a take-home assessment before having a panel interview with four or five members of the lab. The last interview afterwards was a 1-on-1 with the PI. Interview with the PI was casual and just a chance for me to ask any questions to them.
Interview Questions: Why Fred Hutch? What has gotten you interested in software engineering in healthcare? Do you have experience with single cell RNA sequencing?

title: Bioinformatics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Process consisted of an interview and coding tasks (in R, done begore the interview meeting). The interview was brief, and consisted mainly in reviewing the code tasks, where we discussed some of the challenges with each of the assignments, and how I approached each one of them.
Interview Questions: One of the coding tasks involved cleaning a very heterogeneous dataset, and I was asked how I approached this.

title: Statistical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: HR will screen you first, and then the hiring manager will interview you. If you are a good candidates, you will be introduced to the team, where they can ask you questions and you can ask them too
Interview Questions: What's your previous job experience?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 phone screens and then was invited to meet a 5-person panel for an onsite interview. After the in-person interview, the HR recruiter never reached out to let me know the outcome. I sent multiple follow up emails and tried to call, but recruiter did not even bother responding.
Interview Questions: The usual behavioral interview questions.

title: Care Team Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Team interview style. Asked questions about experience, personality, goals and education and why I would be a good fit for the company. Interview lasted nearly 1 hour and was notified the following week.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years from now?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Very standard and smooth process. Multiple rounds of interviews to meet a lot of people on the team. Here is the timeline:
- 08/06/20: Applied online
- 09/01/20: Initial phone screen with HR
- 09/04/20: Virtual interview with hiring manager
- 09/10/20: Virtual interview with two team members
- 09/16/20: Virtual interview with two directors
- 09/18/20: HR reached out for reference and background check
- 09/23/20: Offer
Negotiation went well. Salary is within my desired range.
Interview Questions:
Questions are mostly standard behavior questions or "describe a time when...". Not difficult.
- Why Fred Hutch?
- What do you do to ensure a report's accuracy?
- Name one of your hobbies that could help you succeed in this job.
- What existing procedures do you think you can improve at Fred Hutch?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Interviews spanned two months. The first was a phone screen. Two weeks later was the second; a one-on-one interview with the hiring manager. Two weeks after that was the third; a panel interview with the hiring managers and other Data Analysts. Two weeks after that I received the rejection email. 

I emailed the recruiter asking for feedback on where I could improve to have a better shot next time, but was ghosted. That is very unprofessional. If they are not able to answer the question, the least they can do is send an email saying they can't answer the question. Again, it's very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at FH?

title: Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was straight forward. Met with almost entire team I would be working with. They job and responsibilities were accurately laid out and interviewees made sure I was a good fit.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you at handing different tasks and responsibilities that shift based on newly emerging needs at the clinic?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: They are very friendly and makes you feel at home. It is three steps process. Phone-virtual and presentation to the research group. You need to know your field very well.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join us?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
A phone screen with a recruiter, then radio silence before scheduling the interview with the actual team. 

Here's what happened: During the phone screen, I provided my salary range to which the recruiter said was on the higher end of what they were willing to pay. Right then and there I told the recruiter this position may not be the best fit. He agreed, then said they would keep my resume on file in case something better opened up within the department. Days later I received an email from the recruiter saying he talked to the team and they wanted to interview me anyway. I then provided my availability and was ghosted. This is extremely unprofessional and left a bad impression.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to leave your current position?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Lab Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone screen with a recruiter, which went very well and I was moved on to the 1:1 interview stage. The 1:1 interview was with the hiring manager, and she asked me questions about my experience first, then I asked her questions. After she answered my questions, she simply said, "Ok, well it was great talking to you. Have a nice day" and then the call was over. I wasn't selected, which is completely fine, but I never got an email response saying I wasn't selected, which was incredibly unprofessional and disrespectful. I had to check back in to find out that I wasn't selected, and it left a bad taste in my mouth with the whole experience.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in resolving data discrepancies

title: Clinical Data Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviews consisted of phone screen, interview with manager, interview with team, then another interview with manager, so a phone screen and 3 interviews. The interviews were not difficult, all behavioral stuff.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to coordinate a group of people

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: I received a word from the P.I. of the lab asking for a time to Zoom. On the initial Zoom, she asked a couple of behavioral questions and then some technical questions. I was thinking the first interview was going to be more just giving information on the position.
Interview Questions: Questions about OD and doubling time

title: Clinical Trials Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: The process was seamless from the beginning to the end (when I received an offer!).  Communication was clear, scheduling interview times was easy, and the staff were incredibly kind and professional.
Interview Questions: What I needed from them in order to be a successful employee

title: Post Doc Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Paris)
Interview Descriptions: the scientific interviewer was very pleasant and we further discussed  about my phd project, and some of the main topics related the offers, an further explained me the human ressources procedure, i had appreciated the professional way he interviewed me
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Bioinformatics Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a video interview with the PI. It was mostly basic questions about my experience. The PI also discussed the job role he was interviewing for. It was really easy.
Interview Questions: What do you know about single cell RNA-seq?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position and within a week I was contacted for a phone interview. The format was conversational. Sue, the recruiter for the position, described the role and its context within the organization to set the tone for the call. She was very knowledgable about the department/position. Sue was a wonderful ambassador for the Hutch as she set a positive and friendly tone for the call. Her energy seems to get the best out of applicants. Through our conversation, we determined that the position wasn't the right fit at this time- but nonetheless I left the interaction happier than when it had started!
Interview Questions: If you had to describe what you're looking for in your position with 3 words- what would they be?

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I applied in December
Phone screening with HR
Interview 1: Team of three I would be directly working with
Interview 2: Director and another person in the department

The screening and first interview were very positive and great communication 
2nd round is where it began to go off the rails. I believe that once the director was involved
it became challenging, she came across as a micro-manager and asked a few of the same questions twice. While I want to rate the first two phases of the process very positive,  Interview round 2 was less than positive. I was expected to 'expand' on two answers I had already discussed. This individual muddied the water and I would give it a big thumbs down from that point on.  It became apparent to me I was just one of the herd they were considering, the leadership did not want someone with more than 3 years of experience, my guess is to mold the employee. Salary was low for my experience in Clinical Trial Research, however was willing to overlook that for the opportunity of working for this team. It is just unfortunate, there always seems to be "that" person who may be able provide relevance but makes everyone jump through an extra hoop to accomplish their goal.
Interview Questions: How is your communication style. I was asked this twice during the interview. Either the director was caught up in other thoughts or not paying attention because I was asked to email further discussion on this topic. I work at one of the top hospitals in the United States with some of the most world renowned physicians that Fred Hutch is a SubAward to us. This should not be reinventing the wheel of describing "communication"

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very Easy and friendly process, usually three rounds of interview. The First is with scientific recruiter, then followed by virtual and on site interview with the specific PI you are applying for.
Interview Questions: Research focused, plans for future career

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Post Doctoral Research Fellow Interview
