Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself.
2. Questions about research skills.

title: Staff Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was friendly and quick normal interview. Although nothing hard, meet with all c level and personal. almost 5 people in an interview. questions are normal nothing hard easy. they asked the same question over and over again and no test any whatsoever that is related to the job.
Interview Questions:
tell me about you
why do you want to work here

title: Quality Assurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had a brief initial interview with HR. Which went well. Asked general questions regarding my resume and experience working as an quality personnel. In person interview is scheduled for next week. So if anyone has any suggestions, feel free to comment below.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where your work had an positive impact.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted an application on the company job website and the next day got a call from HR saying the hiring manager wanted to interview me. I had previously done two internship interviews with Fred Hutch so there was no need for another screening.
A week later, went into the interview (30 minutes) and was asked about my resume and why I wanted the job.  I didn't get the job at first because I was going to be out of town for two weeks and they needed someone ASAP but after my vacation, the hiring manager contacted me saying they wanted to bring me on the team.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want this position?
What are your goals after graduation?
How can this position help you achieve your career goals?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
1 round: interview with HR and submit writing sample and code sample
2 round: interview with hiring manager, asked about past experience and current project
3 round: panel interview with 3 groups of people
Interview Questions: categorical analysis

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a Skype call with the HR who asked me mostly general questions about my background and expectations. It was very one sided (the recruiter asking and me answering) which I guess is to be expected when speaking to someone quite far from the position I'm applying to.
Interview Questions:
What do you look for in a manager
What is your experience with the R programming language

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: 10- 15 minute phone screen with a recruiter (mostly asked about my own experiences and why I want to work there with an additional 10- 15 minutes to ask your own questions), additional skype interview with PI if selected
Interview Questions: What are you hoping to get out of this job with respect to your future goals?

title: Q/A Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
Three phone interviews and one in person team interview. The in person interview was a giant mess, people on the panel were scrolling through their phones while I was talking. It was extremely unprofessional and I have never seen that before in a job interview.

I ended up withdrawing my application.
Interview Questions: What your experience and background are like

title: Clinical Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Have a phone-interview with HR and after 2 weeks have interview with manager, then another 3 weeks after interview with other team members. The overall experiences were good. The manager and team members are very nice to communicate, there is no intimidating questions and we really have a good talk.
Interview Questions: Past experiences with database used for clinical data collecting

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The whole interview process is quite great. They have a phone interview first, and they ask you about your experience with the lab that you applied to. It requires two recommendation letters. Later, they schedule you for the in-person interview with the PI. They show you the lab and ask questions about your abilities, your career goals, and so on. Will get the answer on email later whether you pass or not.
Interview Questions: What is your career goal? What are your plans for the future? Do you plan to pursue grad school?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via the Fred Hutch job board. After 2-3 weeks, a recruiter reached out to set up a virtual interview with some members of the team. I received an update on my application shortly after my interview (approximately 24 hours later).
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was  one and half hour video interview .  My experience was really good.  The questions were semi formal  and easy to answer.  It was basically about my past work experience and school projects.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty simple. I applied on 3/27 and was contacted by a recruiter on 4/3 for a phone interview. In person interview was scheduled on 4/4 for an interview date of  4/9. The in person interview was a "loop" interview that was 2 hours long and consisted of two panel interviews. I took about a week for the recruiter to contact me about the hiring manager's decision. So it all happened in about a two week period.
Interview Questions: What interested you in this position?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Difficult process, I was required to be asked to answer a ton of question, and I wasn't properly prepared for such a difficult interview, I needed to exercise my proof of having research experience.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to the table?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Four interviews and screening. The four interviews were back to back for about an hour. During The screening no response to my answers. Which I thought was interesting but they were super nice.
Interview Questions: Basic: Like what is your leadership style?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was well put together and I met the team as well as did a clinic walk through. I was interviewed by 3 staff members who took turns interviewing me.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and work experience

title: Lab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: You sit in the lobby and wait for your interviewer to take you into the lab or surrounding meeting areas. Depending on the lab, you might have to interview with only one person or multiple. The interview is very short, about 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a difficult situation and how did you deal with it?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was quickly contacted by email for a phone screen. I was ready to explain my qualifications, but the recruiter quickly leapt to the two "preferred" qualification requests and forced me to admit I didn't have that degree (PhD for administrative position!!!) or that experience. Then she focused on the more administrative tasks and acted like I should be disqualified because I haven't been an executive assistant before, then managed to suggest I should apply for an EA role instead, which was insulting based on my background (probably not something that happens to male applicants). I was so dumbfounded and offended by the interaction I decided I would not like to move forward (and it certainly didn't sound like she was going to recommend that), but when I was contacted again by her to set up a call with the Hiring Manager, I decided it was worth talking to her to at least explain how terrible their recruiter is. We ended up having a lovely phone call that elicited much more insight into the position and office it manages, so I decided to avoid bringing up their terrible recruiter. Flash forward to a month later, the terrible recruiter sends me a rejection email, where she spells my name wrong and makes egregious grammatical errors. I responded that she should look into hiring a copy editor, which she then responded that she had to send a bunch of these emails and I should basically give her credit for at least responding and letting me know that I was not selected.

Good grief Fred Hutch. Your recruiters are literally scaring people away instead of attracting them to work for you. Seriously reconsider your investment!
Interview Questions: Do you currently schedule for someone?

title: Lab Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed a day after submitting my application to set up a 15-20 minute phone interview with the recruiter. The phone interview covered lots of general questions that you would expect and included salary expectations. I received a follow up pretty immediately to set up a 1.5 hour in person interview. I was an out of state applicant, so I set up a virtual interview instead. It was scheduled for 45 minutes with the supervisor, followed by 45 minutes with the other lab techs. Neither interview actually took that long (~30 minutes each) and the tech asked me a lot more questions than the supervisor did but both were nice and the supervisor was very laid back.
Interview Questions:
What type of data do you collect in your current position? 

What do you look for in a job?

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, responding to a job posting. Initially contacted by an HR person. Later a phone conversation with a technical person. Then on-site interviews with five technical persons lasting ~3 hours. Nice people; pleasant interviews. I thought all went well. Then silence. Not "yes"; not "no"; not "go f--- yourself". Quite disappointing to hear nothing at all. Seems rather rude.
Interview Questions: There was nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with a HR person, asking general questions. Then got an invitation to the in person group interview with PI and team (5 people), asking more of technical questions
Interview Questions: Something about time management

title: Administrative Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very quick. From application submission to job offer was about 2 weeks. This made me wonder how desperate they were to fill the position, so it made me a little weary, but it has worked out. Great people to work with!
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working in a very high touch environment?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: After talking to a recruiter, I sat in a room with three unenthusiastic people asking rote questions and barely listening to my answers. Also, they refused to converse beyond the questions.
Interview Questions: What's an accomplishment you're proud of?

title: Data Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: I got a call about 3 days after my applying for the position to schedule a phone interview. I got the call right on time and it lasted for about 30 minutes where the recruiter got to know me and what my past experience was like as well as why I wanted to work the position I applied for. They informed me the rate at which the manager would be looking to fill the position and how long I should be waiting prior to calling back if I havent heard anything. I received an email 2 days later requesting an in person interview. Because I was living in California at the time, they offered me a time to call through Skype to interview with the manager. I got off the interview with them and received a call about 10 minutes later with a job offer. They also worked with me to manage my move from California to Washington.
Interview Questions: How well are you able to manage working on a particular task and moving between more time sensitive tasks and going back to the initial task?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met one-on-one with the lead nurse for a particular subset of the clinical research division. I had one strike against me immediately, because the recruiter told me to meet her at the wrong building, so she had to walk across the campus to come get me. Was brought into her office, and we spoke privately for about 1.5 hours. She started by going through my resume and asking questions about each job (what I liked/didn't like about each) -- all but my current job were from 4+ years ago -- first thing I wasn't expecting. I wasn't sure if she was going to ever ask me to "tell about yourself" or ask the usual behavioral questions, so I tried to use this opportunity to segue into those, hoping I wouldn't step on the toes of future questions and use up all my material. Strangely nearly all of the non-resume guided questions after that were about managerial style: what I like and don't like in a manager, times when managers did things I appreciated or didn't -- second thing I wasn't expecting. I got the sense that she would be working very closely with the person in this role and wanted to make sure they were a good fit for her, not necessarily for the job or organization. I've never had an interview like that before, it was like speed dating or something. She did ask the typical strengths/weaknesses questions, which provided some respite. The rest of our meeting was her describing their work and filling me in on the nitty gritty of the job (sick days, etc), which I took to be a good sign. She told me she would be taking next steps by contacting my references.
Interview Questions: Are you more introverted or extroverted/do you prefer to work as a team or independently?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screening performed by HR representative. Invited back to campus for 2 separate panel interviews. First interview was with direct team and second interview included other team members and Director of team. Needed to perform a "Skills test" reviewing materials as requested.
Interview Questions: What interests you about the position you applied for?

title: Animal Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with HR. In person interview a few weeks later with the manager. It was really relaxed and easy to talk about my experience and plans for the future.
Interview Questions: What’s your plan for the future?

title: Human Resources Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted within a day of submitting my application and interviewed shortly thereafter. At the conclusion of the panel  interview another person came in to met with me alone, informing me that the usual phone screening had been skipped because of my qualifications and fit for the job.  She explained the urgency of filling the position and proceeded to ask me my salary requirements and other expectations.  She pressed me repeatedly for any requirement I might have, and implied all could be addressed, then she asked me if I had any concerns about the job.  She said she would get back to me in two days.  I never heard from  her or anyone else from Fred Hutch again.  Two months later my status was changed to "not selected" on their on line system.  There was no rejection letter or any other direct communication.
Interview Questions: Questions were basic--how do I prioritize work demands, what is my leadership style, what is a typical day in my current job...

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: the phone and Skype interview set up very quick. Interviewers were very friendly and knowledgeable. You got  the hiring decision quick after the interview. HR is very professional, so they will give you good advice for next steps to fulfill with the document requirement. They also are knowledgeable about visa or work permission for an international student
Interview Questions: what is your experience working with claims data?

title: Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
My experience with this organization was not pleasant. The initial phone screen was robotic, scripted, and bureaucratic.

The technical phone screen wasn't very positive either. The engineer who I spoke with seemed disinterested, tired, and a tad bit disrespectful.

When the day for the on-site interview happened, I showed up and was told, five minutes before the start, that they needed to delay by an hour. When the interview finally did happen, they were not prepared. The person who was supposed to interview me was apparently not available, and his replacement's behavior was inappropriately rude. Zero smiles. Bad attitude throughout, and nothing but psycho analysis questions that he had surely scraped off of google ten minutes before. No technical questions were asked.

When the department manager showed up (15 minutes late), she decided that the interview should be about her talking for 20 minutes straight about herself and how she managed the department.

I should have walked out on these people. This company has some toxic work place problems.
Interview Questions: "How do you handle conflict with others in the workplace?"

title: Information Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first step of the interview process included a brief screening call which followed up with an email to schedule a first round interview. The first round interview lasted two hours, with a panel of three professionals from the department, and included a brief role play.
Interview Questions: What is an example of a time you had to balance conflicting values in the workspace?

title: Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had brief phone interview regarding position, a week later had interview with PI. PI contacted references later that week. Overall a very relaxed interview process. PI was very nice and did not try to create an intimidating environment. Overall recruiting staff were pretty responsive with keeping me updated.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your career in 5 years?

title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Applied through the Fred Hutch Careers site, received a phone call about a week later offering me a phone interview. I sat down with my phone and interview materials on the agreed upon date and time, and the recruiter called me almost 20 minutes late. They did not apologize for or even acknowledge this inconvenience, and proceeded with the interview as if nothing unusual had occurred.

The actual phone interview itself was fine, as far as I could tell - we discussed job duties and salary, and the recruiter told me that I would hear back from them again by the end of the week (this call took place on a Tuesday). The following week, they still hadn't, so I sent a followup email to check in. No response. A week after that I sent another - still no response. Three weeks after the phone interview, I reached out to the person who had scheduled the phone interview (independently from the recruiter who I had actually spoken with), asking them if there had been any updates and explaining the situation. Still nothing.

It has now been more than two months, and I have not received a response or any sort of communication from anyone at Fred Hutch since my phone interview. I feel that this is an extremely unprofessional way to treat prospective hires, and judging by some of the other reviews on here it looks like I'm not the only one. I was never told that I wasn't selected for the position, although I'm not sure how they can expect someone to remain enthusiastic about working for the company after being left in silence and flat-out ignored for several months. Very disappointing, as I had high hopes for Fred Hutch as a company and prospective employer.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in three words.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed to have a phone interview with them and confirmed and they blew me off.  I waited for their call for the interview at the interview time and then called them when there was no call and left a message.  I even tried reaching out to them by email and did not even receive a response back.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by phone (lasted approximately 30 mins). Followed by an in-person interview three weeks later. Following this in-person interview, I was asked to return for a second in-person interview, this time with a group. Weeks passed and I had no response from anyone to  tell me that I was not accepted for the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? What skills do you have which make you suited to the position?

title: Executive Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume, received a phone call a week later from the Recruiting Leader for Fred Hutch.  Seemed like a good connection and she told me that she would definitely call me in a week or so.  I never heard from her even after 2 calls placed to follow up.  I also found it unprofessional that she shared with me that this is the worst recruiting team she has led and she is trying to overhaul the group.
Interview Questions: Why are you looking?  Have you led teams in the past?  How big was the group?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, and got a call back within a day. I scheduled a phone interview the following day. After the phone interview they called back to schedule a skype interview with two of the post docs. It was pretty laid back and a great experience
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience

title: Contractor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen was standard and seemed to go fine. Asking the recruiter questions afterwards resulted in a very hostile response. I expect to be treated professionally with basic respect, and did not see this from the recruiter. Based on my interactions I will not consider Fred Hutch again.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter for a phone interview.  A few days later, the department reached out for   an in-person interview.  Each interview was fairly standard.  There weren't any surprising questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Extremely unprofessional HR team. I received an email from a recruiting coordinator a couple weeks after applying online. I interviewed with a recruiter via phone and was told I would hear back the next week. I didn't hear back for 3 weeks and sent follow up emails to both the recruiting coordinator and the recruiter and got no response until almost a month after the phone interview. They gave the company a bad reputation through this experience.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have that makes you a good fit for this role?

title: Office Worker III Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I was actually hired through a temp agency, so there was never an interview for this particular position.  My supervisor just hired me on the spot after seeing my resume.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two people from the lab which I applied to. The interviewers were very laid back and kind. They asked general questions about me and my experience, nothing technical regarding lab techniques or equipment. The interview lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about what you studied in university and your previous lab experience?

title: Multiple Professional Roles Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
The FHCRC hiring process is one of the worst I have encountered. 

Recruiters are not familiar with the subject matter for which they are recruiting, online tracking process is not accurate, there are significant delays (months!) in follow up and the HR staff has treated myself and other highly qualified professional candidates I've referred with very little respect. 

Note to HR Leadership: I assume your recruiting philosophy is that you want highly qualified candidates who feel like you value them, and vice versa. I have a successful, professional track record and stellar references. I am passionate about cancer research and treatment. At each juncture, I was treated like FHCRC was 'doing me a favor' by interviewing me for a job there - and this was for multiple roles.
Interview Questions: What healthcare experience do you have that is most applicable to this role?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Series of questions asked over the phone, then hired. Related primarily to background in field of study and education. Generic, aside from content questions. They didn't seem to do a great job of advertising this position, so I am not sure how many people they interviewed. I have, however, a great deal of experience with the content required.
Interview Questions: How do you go about finding scientific information to use as a foundation for your curricula?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was Contacted by the PI, asked a few questions about my expectations and then was given on overview of the lab missions. In retrospect, the lab was desperate for people and it was more of the PI selling me the position rather then me applying for it.
Interview Questions: How much do you know about what we study?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: One phone interview with a recruiter talking about what I'm interested in and my qualifications. Then a face to face interview with the head of the lab talking about job specifics and how I would fit into the role.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past research experience.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The process is like any normail process, interviewed by 4 managers that the position will be supporting. The questions weren’t difficult, average to figure out if you can do the job.
Interview Questions: tell me about your experience supporting executives and multiple managers ?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had a fantastic initial interview with a SR Recruiter. She was very laid back, yet professional and facilitated a productive and engaging conversation. Recruiter gave a lot of leeway to speak, and did a good job listening to answers. She also took the time to answer a lot of the questions that I had as well
Interview Questions: Describe how your previous work experience has prepared you to be successful with this job

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had a 30 min phone interview with a recruiter. Received the interview request email 1-2 weeks after the phone interview. Had a group interview (with the lab members). Many asked the same questions.
Interview Questions: Previous work experience

title: Statistical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed for two positions at the same time. The process started in late October, the interviews took place during November, and I still haven't heard back two months later, despite being told they would decide the week after I interviewed. I never received any notification of rejection, and my profile was never updated in their system. I followed up with two different recruiters whom I had been in touch with and heard nothing back - hence the negative review.

Besides that, the interviews themselves were fine. I first had a phone screen interview with a recruiter, then three Skype interviews - one with the managers and then another with each of the two teams I'd be working with. One of the teams only ever asked about experience, and the other team gave me a sample problem to discuss on the spot. The sample problem was pretty basic, but I was caught off guard and whiffed anyway, which was embarrassing.
Interview Questions: Asked questions about experience and showed me a graph of a small sample of trial data to analyze.

title: SAS Statistical Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: My first contact was a phone screen with an HR recruiter which was a very pleasant conversation about my background, why I was interested in working at Fred Hutch, and questions about the projects I had listed on my resume. They did not ask any unexpected questions and were very kind and open about what to expect next. Following this, I scheduled a Skype interview about 1.5 weeks after this and talked to the hiring manager, and 2 potential team members. They asked me several questions about projects on my resume again, but in more detail, and asked me many "what would I do in this situation" questions. Although I was not selected for the role, it was a fun and positive experience.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict you had with a teammate and how did you work to resolve it?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: HR people are quite friendly and get the interview processes done pretty quickly. Overall, the process is well structured and isn't too complicated or time-consuming that it doesn't require us to wait for too long until we receive the final result.
Interview Questions: What makes you stand out for this position?

title: Vice President Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Very organized and professional. After an initial phone screen spent a full day onsite in interviews. Cleary finding a cultural fit was a priority and spoke with over 10 people in different departments over the day.

Collaboration, intellectual curiosity, strong media skills, measured risk taking, emotional intelligence appeared to be high values from the conversation.
Interview Questions:
Describe you management style and success in building and managing teams
Examples of media relations success
Examples of managing board relationships

title: Lab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got an email to schedule phone interview 1 week after applied. Got another email to schedule in person interview with the team. Everyone was friendly and relaxed. Basic questions about education history and experience. The team explained the job duties and what they're doing.  Got the job offer the next day.
Interview Questions:
What do you expect from this job?
What did you study at school that makes you want to work at this lab?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was no phone interview but they requested 1-3 letters of recommendation. Then they contacted me again for a two hour in-person interview. First had a 1:1 interview with a PI and then met other lab members. Some had more questions for me than others. They were all pretty nice.
Interview Questions:
-Stock solution dilution problems
-Why do you want to work in research?/what is your goal as a research technician?
-Are you planning on going to graduate school?
-Other very typical questions

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: They conducted one phone interview and one in person with a panel.  They were both straightforward and relevant to the position.  They also tested for basic writing and proofreading skills.
Interview Questions: How do you handle failure?

title: Business Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position starting of June and received an email from the recruiter end of June. I was first called for Business process analyst then the recruiter thought I was a good match for project manager then after one day he sent me another job description for business analyst. I interviewed for business analyst in July by a panel of interviewers and everyone asking me similar questions. It was not organized and post the interview I waited for one week and thought of emailing the HR how ever the HR never responded and I never heard from them for more then a month now. Very unprofessional and inexperienced staff
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to join us?
Have you worked on any project which went paperless ?
How do you collect data for analysis ?
Have you done any coding ? Although the job description does not mention anything about coding

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I can't go into too much detail, but I will say that HR seems to be a little....disorganized. I experienced this and several people I know have, too. They made some crucial errors during the hiring process. The dept I am working in was absolutely great with the interviews, it was just the HR dept that was lacking. I recommend figuring out an inside contact to communicate with during the process, otherwise I am not sure your resume will even get to the right person. I hope HR can find more staff to help out! They seem understaffed.
Interview Questions: Basic questions about how you handled a particular situation.

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer(s), depending on who was present, ask about your current research/experience and talk about the lab in general. If a particular skill/technique was referenced, they will ask questions about it to check for understanding of what it entails. They usually also give a presentation of the workspace and the staff you would be working with to get a sense of what you would be doing.
Interview Questions:
What would you do to troubleshoot a PCR if it showed no results.
What kind of biological questions do you look at in your current work?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty basic, They call you to do a basic phone screen and interview, then a few days later they call to set up an in person interview. From submitting application the process maybe takes 3 weeks max. The interviewers were very friendly. And i would say the best part is that they update your status on line pretty fast.So before they even email you about your status its up online.
Interview Questions: Most were behavior questions, like give a time when. Or how would you handle this situation.

title: Program Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy interview process that involved a loop panel. It involved speaking to people in the lab and mgrs along with directors. They were easy to talk to and friendly.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work here
Behavioral questions

title: Animal Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone interview 1 week after I applied for the job, and scheduled for an in-person interview 1 week after that. The hiring manager was really nice to talk to and told me she will be contacting my references. She only contacted 2 of my references 2 days after the interview. I got an offer 2 weeks after the interview.
Interview Questions:
Briefly introduce yourself.
Have you had a conflict with your boss, and how did solve it?
What are your strength and weakness?
Have you changed mice cages before?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The HR phone interviewer was around twenty minutes late, but it went well. They asked very basic questions, some about skills that ended up not being relevant to either the position or my experience.
The in person interview with the lab went well, as I met nearly everyone. Many of the same questions were asked by each person. 
I had previously applied to over 100 positions here, and never had an interview. This was the first of any interview I had where they actually had me demonstrate my lab skills instead of only asking me about them. As a result, I was offered the job three business days later.
Interview Questions: How confident are you with sterile technique?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Very casual interview. We talked about the research project and areas that I could potentially focus on during an internship. I was told at the end of the interview that I was welcome to join the team. 

After being offered the research internship communicated with HR about applying for a visa.
Interview Questions: What do you wish to contribute to our research project?

title: Statistical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online; got a phone call 3 weeks latter, and schedule a one-day on-site interview. Spoke with several people about their research and work. They asked me my experience.
Interview Questions: Asked about my past experience.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: applied by online on their site; called, interviewed by three individuals within a week of app. interviews with candidates were back-to-back. job seemed interesting; amazing opportunity to contribute to cancer research. superior asked most questions and was very knowledgeable and friendly; did not develop rapport with other two. it was obvious that interview did not go well.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to us?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Sent CV. Was contacted for telephone interview first. After passing phone interview gave references and list of publications, had a meeting with the PI. On a second interview with the PI I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: What would be challenging of the job

title: Benefactor Relations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I first had a phone screen with HR. I was then given some written exercises to complete. After that I was invited for an onsite interview. For the onsite interview, a group of about 5 individuals, including some outside of the immediate team this position worked with, questioned me for roughly a hour. It was about 4 weeks before I found out whether I had gotten the job.
Interview Questions: How would you approach a nobel laureate to give them tips about giving a presentation to an audience of donors (people who may not have any scientific background)?

title: Grants and Contract Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by a recruiter the following day and then scheduled for an in person with three people. The recruiter said that I would have a modeling test if I was called back for a 2nd interview. I arrived for the 1st interview and was put into a room to write answers to their interview questions and do modeling test all on excel. No one talked to me until after and then made me feel stupid for not performing well on the modeling test (which I was not prepared to take since it was supposed to happen on the 2nd interview). The whole thing threw me...
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you over someone else?

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phonecall from HR recruiter 1 week after I applied, with basic interview questions and my availability for in person interviews.  Two weeks later, I had an in person interview with the Program Director and another PM.  They gave an overview of their program for about 15 minutes, and then had questions for about   30 minutes.  Overall they were polite, but didn't seem to be interested in my responses to their questions.  Seemed like they were trying to scare me with how complicated the position was (I've been in Clinical Research for over 15 years), and it seems like an odd approach at an interview.
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Cancer Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
1st interview was a phone interview with HR.
2nd interview was in-person, the interviewers do mock phone calls about cancer information you are given all the information you need on a print out. You read through it and repeat it essentially word for word.
Hired by phone via HR.
Interview Questions: How do you work on a team? What do you like about this position? Have you been impacted by cancer in some way?

title: Quality Assurance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Five weeks after I applied online, I received an email invitation for a phone interview.  I interviewed with a person from HR and he asked me really basic questions about how my qualifications fit the requirements listed in the job description.  He sounded really positive and told me he would call me in 3 days to set up another interview with the department heads.  I never heard from him again.  I emailed him once, maybe a week later, just to check in and see if he wanted to set something up.  Nothing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your quality assurance experience.

title: Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: phone interview first and then on-site interview. Overall it's not very hard, but still need to prepare it. should be very familier to what you have written in the cv.
Interview Questions: some technical questions and R coding questions

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informal. They ask about your ability to work in teams, what you hope to do in the future, etc. Just be yourself. They really won't ask for anything more than that.
Interview Questions: What do you do if your lab partner is struggling

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Nice and easy. I contacted the PI directly, sent my CV, cover letter, references. Got an answer in 1-2 days and scheduled a skype interview (I lived in Europe at that time). It took ~20 min with standard questions. In the 2 days I was informed that a position is mine and was redirected to immigration specialist.
Interview Questions: What are your long-term career plans?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online through their website. One of their recruiters contacted me by phone about a week later. She asked me a few questions about my background and told me someone else would call me to set up an interview time. The other recruiter called me the next day to schedule my interview.

At Fred Hutch, I met with the PI of the lab. He asked me a few questions about my background, then showed me around the lab and introduced me to everyone working there. The whole thing took less than an hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Statistical Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with lead scientist, then small groups of the rest of then lab starting with upper management down to research associates I would be closely working with. I was from out of town, so I met with everyone in one day, which was nice instead of having to drive back and forth multiple times. Usually there is a longer interview process and you don;t have to meet everyone in one day.
Interview Questions: They asked mostly about the research work I had done and my experiences.

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a phone screening from a recruiter. An in-person interview followed a week later. The interview was supposed to be an hour long and divided into two sections: 30 minutes with someone in HR and 30 minutes with two other staff members. The first part of the interview was normal; however, the second portion was a bizarre experience. One of the interviewers completely dominated conversation, talked about herself incessantly and neglected to ask me any questions. Her colleague was obviously embarrassed and tried to subtly redirect the interview back to me. After that was unsuccessful, she actually checked out of the interview "because she had to go home". Long story short, I was there for another hour and a half, subjected to this woman's stories which ran the gamut of political views on reproductive rights to inappropriate office gossip. I was uncomfortable but didn't know how to end the madness without jeopardizing my chances. The interview ended but not before she revealed another very personal tidbit about herself. I walked back to my car in complete disbelief. Unfortunately, a month has gone by and I never heard from them but my application is still in consideration, according to the website.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Lab Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and about 2 weeks later I received a phone call from HR to schedule an in-person interview. There was no phone screening beforehand. The whole interview process took a little over an hour. I first spoke with the head of the lab who described the work they do and then afterwards got a lab tour and was interviewed further by two lab technicians. The experience was relaxing, I did not feel intimidated and everyone I spoke with was very friendly.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about your work experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Short, and to the point. Asked about past experience, coursework, career goals, and why I was particularly interested in this division. They did ask a few questions that were directly related to their work so I was glad that I had taken the time to read the most recent articles they had published.
Interview Questions: How has your previous coursework prepared you for this position?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with post-doctoral fellow and several other lab members, who were all welcoming and informing. Great experience but did not choose to work here due to a better salary offered elsewhere.
Interview Questions: Which chemokines are upregulated in individuals who produce broadly-neutralizing antibodies for HIV?

title: Animal Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: They called about a month after application. Interview with HR lasted about an hour. I then scheduled interview with Dept Head about a week later. Started work a couple days after that. Everything seemed organized and that if they call you for an interview you will get hired unless you mess up terribly.
Interview Questions: Are you ok euthanizing animals?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview > Team Interview > Direct Supervisor Interview.  The phone interview was 30-45 minutes.  The interviewers reviewed my work history and background as well as gave me a realistic job preview.  The team interview was a lot of fun because it gave both me and the group I would be working with a chance to meet and interact with each other before I became a member of the organization.  The interview with the direct supervisor followed and it was a continuation of the group interview but a bit more in depth.
Interview Questions: (Just one example).  Tell me about a hiring challenge that you faced and how you overcame it.  What did you learn that you could apply in the future?

title: Sdfd Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Hiring was done after a phone screen and then a full day interview with the team , supervisor, other clinicians. Lunch was provided and the people were friendly and will give you overview of how it is to work in that organization
Interview Questions: how can you relate your experience with the job

title: Lab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and did not hear back for a few weeks. Followed up by e-mail to lab coordinator. Scheduled phone interview a month after applying online. Asked basic questions: "post-graduation plans? Long-term goals? Why our lab?" Was then asked to come in for an in-person interview. Was greeted by the coordinator who interviewed me for half an hour then interviewed by two other lab technicians who are currently working in the lab. Very friendly and inviting. Asked lots of questions regarding scenarios that can occur in the lab, calculating concentrations, etc.
Interview Questions: Calculating molarity or specific lab preparation questions: "If you have a stock concentration of X M...etc."

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Like others here have said, it took the better part of two months to hear back. So long that I'd written them off and for the most part had forgotten I'd even applied.

Phone interview: Recruiter seemed to enjoy spending more time talking about a lot of hot air than actually listening. When asked about tangible benefits like paid holidays he said, "We offer more paid holidays than banks! Look on a calendar and if it's a holiday we probably observe it!" Yet he didn't answer the question.

When asked about paid vacation he dodged again, and in a round about way said two weeks, following that up with a lengthy statement about how you really could take as much time as you wanted regardless what the actual vacation policy is, that it's really no problem. Umm... Yeah... Sure...

The salary range was abysmally low. I understand that working for 1) big orgs, and 2) big non-profit orgs tends to skew the salary on the low end, but you could make more money slinging burgers at a fast food joint.

The recruiter told me during the interview that they were also hiring a Senior Dev position that would manage the group (the worst of both worlds, IMO). It was a positin I was unaware of and when I asked if he could tell me more about it as it fit my skill set better, he said I should go onto their site and look it up and get back to him because he didn't have it in front of him. I replied via email with some general questions about salary, expectations, time spent managing vs time spent coding, etc., and didn't hear anything back. After 10 days I sent a polite follow up email, more out of annoyance than anything else, and the recruiter replied a week after that to apologize that he'd been out of town (odd, as there were no OOO auto-replies) and that I should call him and he'd be happy to answer my questions. Again, dodging the questions I put to him. 

For all the great work FHCRC does, they certainly make a sleazy impression on the recruiting end. Between an insultingly low salary and a recruiter that came across more like a used car salesman, I decided not to pursue things further. Thanks, no thanks.
Interview Questions: Really, the most difficult thing was getting through the phoner without wanting to shout at the recruiter to stop talking about himself.

title: Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There were two phone screens and two in-person interviews. At first HR interviewed me to place me for positions. Then, the hiring manager interviewed me. Then, the team interviewed me.
Interview Questions:
Explain data cleaning you've done in the past, especially in regards to merging datasets

Explain how you deal with difficult people

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call from hiring manager for a preview screening. Called in for interview with two people and was a very fair and thorough interview.  Called again by another supervisor for final interview and offer. .
Interview Questions: What is one weakness?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Submit application through companies website.  interview process is mainly completed by department manager and can also have a follow up interview with other management. Working interview is sometimes performed , given applicant to have a feeling of environment and other workers.  Informed of higher over phone or in person and then a facility tour and then set with HR for all the required paper work
Interview Questions: How long I plan on being with the company

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was contacted by Human Resources by phone for an interview. I interviewed with the team and then was called back a second time for an interview with their supervisor. Human Resources offered the job and, after some negotiation, I accepted.
The process went smoothly and communication was clear.
Interview Questions: None.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brief, not many questions, most of the time was spent talking about scope of work to be done.  This was at a very busy time in research (which is actually not the case now)
Interview Questions: specific instrument and assay questions

title: Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I replied to a posted advertisement via email. About 2 weeks latter I received an email request for a phone interview with a member of the HR staff. This interview covered my qualifications, experience and ability to collaborate with, and manage others. It lasted about 20 minutes. A few days after this a second telephone interview was organized with the research team. This lasted about 40 minutes with a lot of questions on my educational and work history as well as specific questions about my current research. A week latter I was invited for a face-to-face interview with faculty and team members. This included presenting my current research as an open lecture to the center. I received an offer about 2 weeks latter.
Interview Questions: Do you think you are adequately trained for this position?

title: Protocol Review Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application online due to internal employee referral, receive phone call next day to schedule phone interview. Phone interview was casual and had the usual preliminary questions. Received call back later to schedule in person approximately 7 days. In-person interview consisted of 2 department employees and was somewhat casual. Honest and frank discussion about expectations, environment and growth potential. Was told about next steps and had a delayed response in communication (more than 10 days). When I did receive a phone call it was to say their process is taking longer than expected and that I should be hearing back "soon". Have yet to receive that communication.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave you current employer for this position at The Hutch?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview lasted for 30 minutes. The in person interview lasted for about 15 minutes. HR asked two very broad questions that did not allow me to go into detail about my work experiences. It seemed like they had a candidate already in mind because I felt rushed. Apply here if you want to waste your time. A better recruiting and interviewing process needs to be implemented in HR. This was the worst interview experience ever.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Everything is coordinated through HR, which makes the process a bit clumsy. 
1) HR contacts you to set up a phone interview. If scheduling is a problem they may need to call the manager and then call you back, rinse and repeat. 2) If phone interview is good, HR contacts you to set up in-person interview. Again, this can be a pain to get scheduled. 3) Possible multiple in-person interviews. Mine were all fairly casual Q&A type events--no tests or anything like that. 4) HR will contact you with an offer. In my case, when I countered the offer the HR person was able to respond without checking in with a manager, so I guess they were given a cap ahead of time. 5) Once hired, work with HR to fill out paperwork!
Interview Questions: They asked why I would leave my old job if I loved it so much (I'd raved about it earlier in the conversation).

title: Systems Analyst/Programmer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews with several people at each interview. Interviewing process is unnecessarily drawn out.
Interview Questions: What makes you think you can raise optimism?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was with the hiring manager, the second interview was with the team, and the third interview was with others with whom the position would work closely.   The total number of interviews seemed extremely excessive for a simple contract position.  Everyone was nice enough, but some personalities seemed belligerent and unfamiliar with legally acceptable interview questions.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this position?

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: behavior questions, more technical questions and the phone interview last for like30 mins.
Interview Questions: how much do you except the salary to be?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: REGUALAR BACK AND FORTH OF ENDLESS EMAILS AND THEN THE PI ASKED ME TO PRESENT IT in a lab meeting and some quite simple questions to be answered before my offer was issued. I did not feel hardtime at all and the whole process was super easy.
Interview Questions:
REGUALAR QUESTIONS AND NOT IMPRESSIVE AT ALL, BUT TALKING TO DIFFERENT MEMEMBERS OF THE WHOLE LAB, A WASTE OF TIME.
Questions was pretty basic such as where I worked before, why I came to Seattle, why I am interested in the PI'S lab work and what is my future plan to work as a scientist in the lab.l

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: My initial interview was with HR, then an interview with Tim Ball, LPN & Lab Mgr.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Staff Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: GENERALL PEOPLE ARE NICE HERE. but they will know what they wnat. pretty competitive environment here. not very generous in terms of payment of the interview expense. much less generous than industry.  good communication skill are required to achieve an offer. beatiful view and life condition here. about 2000 employees here and so many asian  chinese scientist around the center. biology, and statitician are most favoriable postion in htis center
Interview Questions: what is you previosu experience

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview.
2. Day one, 1:1 interview with manager.
3. Day two, 1:1 interview with P.I.

Interview asked everything that was listed in the job requirements.  Never did they ask "how do you handle personality conflicts?"  To me, that's a red flag.
Interview Questions: There was not a tough interview question.  Just had to read and relate my experiences to the list of potential questions.

title: Post Doctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Very easy - just met with PI and talked about experience/interests. Met with senior staff members (should have met with other post docs - environment not the same for junior post docts).
Interview Questions: When can you start - wanted immediately.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Fred Hutch Cancer Center in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: You'll submit a resume online and it will be reviewed by a "resume robot". You probably won't  hear anything for many months, and then you'll be extremely surprised to receive a call from HR. HR will schedule your interviews, which will include an one interview (approximately an hour) with the group you'll be working with and another interview with HR during which they'll explain the nuts and bolts, including benefits, compensation, etc. Most of the questions will come from the group that you'll be working with and there's really no way to predict what questions they'll ask you, but it will probably be pretty typical interview stuff for the field. There will be another very long wait period during which you'll think they forgot about it - possibly months. Then, you'll be asked in for a second interview, possibly with a larger group of people you'll be working with. Again, the questions will depend on the group. The whole interview process is long and drawn out so you'll have to be patient. Feel free to hound HR with phone calls, but be polite.
Interview Questions: I really don't remember any particularly difficult or surprising questions.
